titlestmt.titleproper: Inventory of the Frederick F. Ploetz Papers, 1941-1967

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Leslie Waggener. 2017

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: University of Wyoming. American Heritage Center.

did.abstract: Papers of a World War II pilot with the Flying Tigers, a group composed of pilots from the U.S. Army Air Corps, Navy, and Marine Corps.

bioghist.head: Biography of Frederick F. Ploetz
bioghist.p: Frederick Ferdinand Ploetz (1914-1972) was a World War II pilot with the Flying Tigers, a group composed of pilots from the U.S. Army Air Corps, Navy, and Marine Corps. Ploetz is credited with destroying two enemy aircraft in aerial combat during World War II and was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross. He then became a career Air Force officer attaining the rank of colonel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Most of the collection contains Ploetz’s military orders and special orders (1941-1967). Also included are correspondence (1941-1967); newspaper clippings about Ploetz (1955-1967); photographs of Ploetz and military subjects (1941-1963); a U.S. Air Force ROTC summer camp schedule (1952); awards and certificates given to Ploetz; artifacts from Ploetz’s Far East duty; and foreign currency.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: There are no access restrictions on the materials for research purposes, and the collection is open to the public.

userestrict.head: Copyright Information
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There are no known other archival collections created by Frederick F. Ploetz at the date of processing.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This material was received from Thelma Ploetz in 1973.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
